result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Horton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  30 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay by due date.

Defendant Joseph J Horton in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Matthew J. Hastings for Rebecca Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NG plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

from Atty Jensen re: defendant's whereabouts, including documentation from defendant's agent in IL that he is on house arrest until 1/17/15.  (per CC Rudebusch, bw/bf stayed until next court appearance 2/11/15)

Attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense requests an adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted. Finding of good cause to waive time limits.   No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited stayed until 12/3/14.
Arraignment on November 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC 2nd & subsequent; Ct 2: 961.573(1)-PDP. ******11/12/14 GPS MONITORING IS TO BE REMOVED*****   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   No contact with the co-actor (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the Riverside Inn on Northwestern Ave.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to house arrest are meetings with attorney, court appearances and employment.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Reading waived.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
